comment.author: 41378066@N00
comment._content: wtf?  There is no visible engines on this "aircraft" . Looks like a "Make work" project for Marine recruits. The life expectancy for this "aircraft in combat would be seven seconds. (give or take a second)

comment.author: 60987721@N00
comment._content: It wasn't meant to fly independently. The balloon was attached to cables, floated high aloft above a battlefield, and the attached cables stretching across the sky made it impossible for enemy aircraft to provide close air support to troops on the ground. If they tried, the cables would rip the planes to pieces. Wiki en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barrage_balloon

comment.author: 41378066@N00
comment._content: Thanks rrsafety ....That makes sense. I'm glad they didn't put troops in that contraption
